tweets.text:
#OnThisDay in 1864 the #DaleDykeDam collapsed resulting in the #GreatSheffieldFlood. Believed to be caused by a crack in the embankment.

It released around 3million m3 of flood water through the #PeakDistrict & #Sheffield.

Sadly it resulted in 250 deaths & destroyed 600 homes. https://t.co/K6Ztk3gppI
@sony991 @MattBoughton93 A quick update - our team has been out today and we've cleared trollies and other debris from this section of the river.

@GarethDDaviesEA @TM_WRT @NENorthWest @EnvAgencyNW @CefasGovUK WOW. That is a beast. Shame you didn't catch it on a rod and line.
Jon Ellis of @CRTFisheries has a picture of a 30g bullhead they found on a fish rescue. That was also over the British Record. Just shows big (small) fish are out there to be caught

We're launching a new project - NatureBid!

It awards funding to landowners in the Upper Aire to improve water quality & natural flood management. Works considered include leaky dams, tree planting & more!

More info üëâ https://t.co/pBJQjFTEiw

@EnvAgencyYNE @SylvaFoundation

A team of climate leaders has been selected for the new Yorkshire and Humber Climate Commission. 

A Chair, three Vice-Chairs, a Director and 25 Commissioners have been appointed, all united in their ambition and commitment to tackling the climate crisis.

https://t.co/fyqrocQf2W https://t.co/PvJamEch19

urls.title: Northumberland river sets new course after bank breach
urls.description: The River Coquet in Northumberland has taken a new course after overtopping its banks during heavy rain last month.

tweets.text:
We've carried out fish rescues on the River Coquet near Rothbury after a bank breach during heavy rain last month. 

The river has now set a new course and we've moved more than 250 fish from the depleted channel into the new stretch. 

Read more here: https://t.co/rRIKK2nYgt https://t.co/lgxcdCfa0e

@Nationliverpoo @CroxtethHall @merseyforest @EnvAgencyNW @cpvolgroup It would be a great name for a football team! 
I believe they cover the Merseyside area hence the 'Mersey'. But trees are an important part of a river system...on banks and floodplains rather than in the river

@Nationliverpoo @CroxtethHall @merseyforest @EnvAgencyNW @cpvolgroup All are in the county of Merseyside and all are in the Mersey Basin i.e. the rivers that flow through St Helens etc all eventually flow into the River Mersey. Hope that helps üôÇ

The many benefits of having healthy #soil was the topic of a talk for our delegates at #NFMCoP by @ilkleyIain from @EnvAgencyYNE.

Iain encourages #farmers to exchange knowledge with each other & gave tips for monitoring soil. https://t.co/LOOQbePnYk

@MarkDampier @Vic_Gill @theriverstrust @UK_CEH @EnvAgency Quite agree. The targets are abstract and creating a monster of resource misallocation without improving people‚Äôs lives or the natural environment quickly.
